abstract.p: Napster makes its final written presentation to US Appeal Court, seeking to overturn lower court decision in July that threatens to shut down company by blocking major-label songs from being traded on Napster service (S)

block.p: Napster, the Web-based music software company whose program lets consumers download and share music files, made its final written presentation yesterday to the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit in San Francisco. The presentation was in reply to the brief filed last week by the Recording Industry Association of America, the plaintiff in the case. Napster, based in Redwood City, Calif., is seeking to overturn a lower court decision in July that threatens to shut down the company by blocking major-label songs from being traded on the Napster service. Napster's presentation asserts that its service does not diminish the value of the music copyrights, insisting rather that the RIAA is trying to maintain control over music distribution. Oral arguments in the case are scheduled for Oct. 2.
